00018 Preprocessor::Preprocessor ()
00019     : optimalThreshold_(0), backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_(255),
00020     noiseRemovalTime_(0.0), optimalThresholdComputingTime_(0.0), backgroundReferenceGrayLevelFindingTime_(0.0)

00032 unsigned char Preprocessor::computeOptimalThreshold (const Clip &clip)
00033 {
00034     // Find background reference gray level
00035     findBackgroundReferenceGrayLevel(clip);
00036     
00037     
00038     // Get the pixels of the clip (this is faster than calling clip.getPixelGrayLevel() each time)
00039     std::vector<unsigned char> pixels = clip.pixels();
00040     
00041     
00042     // Start with an initial threshold
00043     optimalThreshold_ = backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_;
00044     unsigned char currentThreshold = not optimalThreshold_; // Enforces current threshold to be different so the firts loop is always made
00045     
00046     
00047     // Loop as many times as needed to find the optimal threshold by averaging the pixel gray levels
00048     while (currentThreshold not_eq optimalThreshold_)
00049     {
00050         unsigned int backgroundMeanValue = 0, objectsMeanValue = 0;
00051         unsigned int nSamples = 0;
00052         
00053         std::vector<unsigned char>::iterator pixelsIterator;
00054         
00055         // Compute the background and objects mean values
00056         for ( pixelsIterator = pixels.begin(); pixelsIterator not_eq pixels.end(); ++pixelsIterator )
00057         {
00058             unsigned char grayLevel = *pixelsIterator;
00059             
00060             if ( grayLevel >= optimalThreshold_ )
00061             {
00062                 backgroundMeanValue += grayLevel;
00063                 nSamples++;
00064             }
00065             else
00066                 objectsMeanValue += grayLevel;
00067         }
00068         backgroundMeanValue = round(backgroundMeanValue / nSamples);
00069         objectsMeanValue = round(objectsMeanValue / (clip.nPixels() - nSamples));
00070 
00071 
00072         // Update the optimal threshold keeping the last one
00073         currentThreshold = optimalThreshold_;
00074         optimalThreshold_ = static_cast<unsigned char>( round((objectsMeanValue + backgroundMeanValue) / 2) );
00075     }
00076 
00077     return optimalThreshold_;
00078 };

00086 unsigned char Preprocessor::findBackgroundReferenceGrayLevel (const Clip &clip, const unsigned int &referenceGrayLevelNeighbours)
00087 {
00088     // Get the pixels of the clip (this is faster than calling clip.getPixelGrayLevel() each time)
00089     std::vector<unsigned char> pixels = clip.pixels();
00090     
00091     
00092     // Compute clip histogram
00093     std::vector<unsigned int> histogram(256, 0);
00094     std::vector<unsigned char>::iterator pixelsIterator;
00095     
00096     for ( pixelsIterator = pixels.begin(); pixelsIterator not_eq pixels.end(); ++pixelsIterator )
00097         histogram[*pixelsIterator] += 1;
00098     
00099         
00100     // Search the more frequent level of gray
00101     std::vector<unsigned int>::iterator histogramIterator;
00102     unsigned char moreFrequentGrayLevel = 0, levelCounter = 0;
00103 
00104     for (histogramIterator = histogram.begin(); histogramIterator not_eq histogram.end(); ++histogramIterator, ++levelCounter)
00105     {
00106         if ( *histogramIterator > histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel] )
00107             moreFrequentGrayLevel = levelCounter;
00108     }
00109     unsigned int referenceGrayLevel = moreFrequentGrayLevel * histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel];
00110 
00111 
00112     // Search the neighbours of the more frequent level of gray
00113     std::vector<unsigned int>::reverse_iterator histogramReverseIterator( std::find (histogram.rbegin(), histogram.rend(), histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel])++ );
00114     histogramIterator = histogramReverseIterator.base()++;
00115     unsigned int nFrequencies = histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel];
00116 
00117     for ( unsigned int i = 1; i <= referenceGrayLevelNeighbours; ++i )
00118     {
00119         // Search forwards
00120         if ( histogramIterator not_eq histogram.end() )
00121         {
00122             referenceGrayLevel  += (moreFrequentGrayLevel + i) * histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel + i];
00123             nFrequencies        += histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel + i];
00124 
00125             ++histogramIterator;
00126         }
00127 
00128         // Search backwards
00129         if ( histogramReverseIterator not_eq histogram.rend() )
00130         {
00131             referenceGrayLevel  += (moreFrequentGrayLevel - i) * histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel - i];
00132             nFrequencies        += histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel - i];
00133 
00134             ++histogramReverseIterator;
00135         }
00136     }
00137 
00138 
00139     // Set the background reference gray level found
00140     backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ = static_cast<unsigned char>( round(referenceGrayLevel / nFrequencies) );
00141     return backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_;
00142 };

00144 
00150 void Preprocessor::removeIsolatedNoise (Clip &clip, const unsigned int &isolationCoefficient)
00151 {
00152     // Find background reference gray level
00153     findBackgroundReferenceGrayLevel(clip);
00154 
00155 
00156     // Loop over the clip to remove every noisy isolated pixel
00157     for (unsigned int i=0; i < clip.height(); ++i)
00158     {
00159         for (unsigned int j=0; j < clip.width(); ++j)
00160         {
00161             unsigned char pixelGrayLevel = clip.getPixelGrayLevel(i, j);
00162             
00163             // Comparison values to avoid pixels that clearly belong to the background
00164             bool backgroundPixelOnWhite = (backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ > optimalThreshold_) and (pixelGrayLevel > backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_);
00165             bool backgroundPixelOnBlack = (backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ < optimalThreshold_) and (pixelGrayLevel < backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_);
00166             
00167             if ( not backgroundPixelOnBlack and not backgroundPixelOnWhite )
00168             {
00169                 unsigned int nBackgroundPixels = 0, nPixels = 0;
00170 
00171                 // Explore the pixel neighbourhood
00172                 for(int p = i-1; p < static_cast<int>(i+2); p++)
00173                 {
00174                     for(int q = j-1; q < static_cast<int>(j+2); q++)
00175                     {
00176                         // Comparison values to avoid step outside the image and the central pixel
00177                         bool heightOverflow = (p < 0) or (p >= static_cast<int>(clip.height()));
00178                         bool widthOverflow  = (q < 0) or (q >= static_cast<int>(clip.width()));
00179                         bool isCentralPixel = (p == static_cast<int>(i)) and (q == static_cast<int>(j));
00180                         
00181                         if ( not heightOverflow and not widthOverflow and not isCentralPixel )
00182                         {
00183                             // Update pixels counter
00184                             nPixels++;
00185 
00186                             // Get neighbour pixel gray level
00187                             unsigned char neighbourPixelGrayLevel = clip.getPixelGrayLevel(p, q);
00188 
00189                             // When background gray level is close to white but not the pixel, update the noisy neighbours counter
00190                             if ( (backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ > optimalThreshold_) and (neighbourPixelGrayLevel > optimalThreshold_) )
00191                                 nBackgroundPixels++;
00192                             else
00193                             {
00194                                 // When background gray level is close to black but not the pixel, update the noisy neighbours counter
00195                                 if ( (backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ < optimalThreshold_) and (neighbourPixelGrayLevel < optimalThreshold_) )
00196                                     nBackgroundPixels++;
00197                             }
00198                         }
00199                     }
00200                 }
00201 
00202                 // Clear the noisy pixel if it is isolated
00203                 if (nBackgroundPixels >= (nPixels - isolationCoefficient))
00204                     clip.setPixelGrayLevel(i, j, backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_);
00205             }
00206         }
00207     }
00208 };
